Methods for sparse_numeric objects

Source: R/sparse_numeric-methods-doc.R, R/sparse_numeric.R
sparse_numeric-methods.Rd

S4 methods defined for the sparse_numeric class, including arithmetic operators, norms, and utility functions.

Usage

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric'
show(object)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
sparse_add(x, y)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
sparse_sub(x, y)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
sparse_mult(x, y)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
sparse_crossprod(x, y)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
e1 + e2

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
e1 - e2

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
e1 * e2

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric'
norm(x, ...)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric'
standardize(x, ...)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric'
plot(x, y, ...)

# S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric'
length(x)

Arguments

object

A sparse_numeric object.

x, y, e1, e2

sparse_numeric objects used as operands in arithmetic or utility methods.

...

Additional arguments passed to methods (currently ignored).

Details

This help topic exists primarily to satisfy R CMD check that these methods are documented. See the documentation for the sparse_numeric class and the corresponding generics for details on behavior.
